video_title: Should you buy a Fiber or a CO2 Laser?
comment_text: I work with industrial grade flatbed lasers. Both fiber and c02. We can cut up to 3/4" thick steel. Everything we cut requires assist gas such as nitrogen or oxygen. We've played around with etching and finite cuts for delicate materials but they're just not well suited to operate on such low wattage.

comment_text: I have just purchased an LP2  (1 week ago) maybe it would be a good idea to explain a little more about it's very poor software...The app i downloaded via the playstore is a dogs breakfast....it only has 4..YES 4 fonts  which are all similar and you cannot download any more to this ridiculous closed ended app, every review i have watched so far would appear to have a different set of vectors than those i have on my app which are very limited in number and very poor choices... it can't be used with a mac unless you buy an optional dongle,  it disconnects from the machine if your screen times out while setting it up?  All the reviews i have seen keep showing a window with pre set calculations as a guide to show you what the settings should be for different materials...mine does not have any such window!  The hardware looks good but it can only excel if its software is well thought out...THIS ISN'T. it is very frustrating and to cap it all i have just tried to leave a product review on Amazon but strangely Amazon keep telling me they can't find the product i purchased new just one week ago?.. all my other purchases are still there waiting to be reviewed .I I wonder if they are getting a lot of returns.

video_title: This Laser Can Engrave METAL!  -  OMTech 20W Fiber Laser Review
comment_text: I have a project which is going to involve making a lot of small custom designed parts made from aluminium and also carbon fiber.  One of my friends was recommending I look at diode lasers.  However these are really bad a cutting aluminium and carbon fiber is really hard.  I've seen the fiber lasers are much better for aluminium.  There is also some evidence from youtube the fiber lasers can also now cut carbon fibre.  However, I can't find many reviews using the fiber lasers to cut carbon fibre.  In short, I'm wondering if only a MOPA fiber laser can cut carbon fiber?  If you could let me know your thoughts that could make a big difference to me.  Looks like the 'Max' fiber lasers are also best avoided!

comment_text:
I would never go the Glowforge route for the same reason that I have never and will never go for iPhone over Samsung or Mac over PC. Apple are monopolists. That is to say, if you buy an Apple product you are buying into a closed ecosystem that does not allow for competition, meaning that whatever you need beyond the basic product itself, i.e., accessories, software, etc., can only be purchased from Apple at whatever price Apple dictates, take it or leave it.

Glowforge have obviously decided to emulate the Apple everything-in-house business model and for me their online-only obligatory subscription software model that excludes all other possibilities is a deal breaker, and that's before taking into account the fact that the product costs twice as much as the Gwieke. If I buy something, I own it _not_ it owns me.

video_title: Top Laser Engravers and Cutters to Get in 2022
comment_text: Oh yea, I used to work for a company that did precision laser cutting, drilling, skiving, micro-vias and occasionally engraving. We had machines in the hundreds of thousands of dollars range, even a few into a million dollar range. ESI was a brand, from China I believe, that we had that did UV lasers. Another was the Excellon Cobra which had both UV and CO2 in 1 machine so you could cut/skive/drill with one and do a finish pass with the other. Or a multilayer panel with different materials like copper and dielectric. Cool stuff. Have been thinking about getting a laser engraver for some product ideas I have

comment_text: Note to anyone thinking of purchasing - the 40w module and the extension are not YET compatible. The 40w requires a different power cable and they haven't made one long enough for the extension yet and will not be available for several weeks. They don't tell you this, so I am sharing here.
